photo.description: Piazza De Ferrari, Genua, 29 sierpnia 2012 r. Plac z charakterystyczną fontanną stanowi swoistą bramę pomiędzy starą i nowoczesną Genuą. Plac otaczają: Pałac Dożów, siedziba władz regionu, pałac Akademii Sztuk Pięknych, Teatr Carlo Felice, budynek dawnej giełdy (obecnie bank), pałac Raffaele De Ferrariego (doży w latach 1787-89). ** Piazza De Ferrari, Genoa, August 29, 2012 The square with the distinctive fountain constitutes a kind of gateway between the old and the new Genoa. It is surrounded by: the Palace of the Doges, palace of the Academy of Fine Arts, Carlo Felice theatre, old stock exchange building (currently a bank), palace of Raffaele De Ferrari (the doge in 1787-89).

photo.description: Genoa: Carlo Felice Theatre Built on the site of the old Carlo Felice, the new theatre, designed by Aldo Rossi, is based on an idea that was already apparent in projects by Chela and Scarpa: to set up a covered area of 400 square metres, in which the theatre would serve as the ideal link between Galleria Mazzini and piazza De Ferrari. Carlo Felice Official Site View On Black
